page.title: 15Transport
page.content: The major forms of transport are firsty the motor car and secondly the school bus which takes children to Inverurie. There are no major roads in the block, only winding country roads as you would expect in a heavily agricultural yet hilly landscape. Many farms are cut off by snow in winter due to the nature of the roads. All children at school in Inverurie must have a 'snow address', a home of a relative or family friend where they can sleep overnight when country areas are inaccessible due to snow. The school bus service is the only regular bus transport through this area.
